meanings.definition: To return to one's home country after living abroad.
meanings.sent1: After many years in a foreign land, Maria is remigrating to her homeland.
meanings.sent2: John is planning on remigrating to his native country next month.
meanings.sent3: The cat, tired of exploring, decided it was time to remigrate back to its cozy home.
meanings.sent4: The idea of remigrating to familiar surroundings felt like a warm embrace after years of wandering.
meanings.sent5: The image of her childhood home kept calling her, urging her to remigrate and reconnect with her roots.

meanings.definition: The act of moving back to one's place of origin.
meanings.sent1: The remigrating of many families to their hometowns was a heartwarming sight.
meanings.sent2: The remigrating of the birds signaled the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent3: The sudden remigrating of the students to the school cafeteria surprised the teachers.
meanings.sent4: The concept of remigrating to one's birthplace felt like a comforting tradition.
meanings.sent5: The remigrating of the elderly to their childhood neighborhoods brought back fond memories for the community.
